Ford announced Monday that over  more workers have been temporarily laid off due to  from the ongoing strike against the company and two other US automakers PERIOD

The strike against the socalled  car manufacturers  Ford Stellantis and General Motors  began on September  when a previous contract expired without a replacement PERIOD

Instead of calling for all of its  members to strike at once the United Auto Workers UAW union has deployed a targeted approach adding more sites as the weeks drag on PERIOD

Around  members have so far been called to stop work PERIOD

 Ford said in a statement on Monday PERIOD

 the statement added saying the total number of  at Ford now totaled  PERIOD

Ford said its sites impacted by Mondays announcement were in Chicago Illinois and Lima Ohio PERIOD

Stellantis and General Motors have also reduced staff at several sites for the same reasons PERIOD

Initially the UAW called on some  members at the three automakers to stop work then added another  a week later due to lack of progress in negotiations PERIOD A further  were added the following week to bring the total to some  PERIOD
